definition: to have both (at the same time)
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Most interactional sites are actually hybrids.
sentences.chinese: 大多数交互性网站实际兼而有之。

sentences.english: The psychology of the market is one that includes both the psychology of investing and the psychology of gambling.
sentences.chinese: 市场的心态表现出投机与赌博兼而有之的两重性。

sentences.english: Notice by the by that logically speaking, there is nothing that stops the very same thing from being both.
sentences.chinese: 请注意在逻辑上而言，没有东西阻止两者兼而有之。
但猫眼石，却可能兼而有之。
但猫眼石，却可能兼而有之。

sentences.english: WEP keys can be numeric , alphabetic, or a combination of both.
sentences.chinese: WEP密钥可以是数字，字母，或两者兼而有之。

sentences.english: However, my experience was not this black and white. I had a bit of each.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我的经历并非这么非黑即白，是兼而有之吧。

definition: to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to exist at the same time/to coexist
by no means an isolated case/numerous
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
